com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.DialogFragments

Class YNDialogFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • android.app.DialogFragment
        • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.DialogFragments.YNDialogFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class YNDialogFragment
extends android.app.DialogFragment
    Implements a basic Yes/No dialog interface with a customizable layout. All internal variables are public, convenience access methods are included. Delegates result status to a provided handler object. Returned result codes will be DialogActionEventHandler.ResultID.POSITIVE or DialogActionEventHandler.ResultID.NEGATIVE, depending on user response.

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.String yesButtonText,
                          java.lang.String noButtonText,
                          int layoutID,
                          DialogActionEventHandler handler)
        Sets this object's interface properties. Variables referenced are public, but this method is provided for convenience. Providing a null value for one or more of these arguments will reset the corresponding variable to its default setting, specified in the strings.xml file.
        Parameters:
        message - the message (could be considered the 'title' of the dialog) to display
        yesButtonText - the text to display on the button that returns true
        noButtonText - the text to display on the button that returns false
        layoutID - the Android Layout ID to use for a custom layout in the shown dialog. Set the ID to -1 to use the default layout.
        handler - a DialogActionEventHandler class to handle the result of the dialog. The result code given to the handler class will correspond to the type of response given - DialogActionEventHandler.ResultID.POSITIVE or DialogActionEventHandler.ResultID.NEGATIVE.
